primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God, as the source of all Light (Life, Truth, Beauty), descends into cosmic darkness in Christ to redeem humanity, thereby transforming the receiver into a reflection of that light.

tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus Christ is the divine Light come into a dark world
He experienced the darkness we deserve so we could be light

object.identificatie: Redemption and the restoration of 'Life, Truth, and Beauty' to the human soul.
tekstueel_bewijs: I, the Lord, am your Savior, your Redeemer

zender.identificatie: God the Father / The Divine Nature
tekstueel_bewijs: God is the source of all life
nations will come to your light
you are the light of the world
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is positioned as the Receiver of the light who then becomes a secondary Subject.

helper.identificatie: The Holy Spirit / The Work of Christ on the Cross
tekstueel_bewijs: if you have actually experienced the Holy Spirit in your life
Jesus Christ voluntarily... letting himself fall into darkness for you
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject who provides the Help through His own person (Christ).

tegenstander.identificatie: Cosmic Darkness, Sin, and the 'Wrong Loves' of the human heart.
tekstueel_bewijs: thick darkness is over the peoples
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Darkness is defined as total separation from God (Hell), requiring a divine sacrifice to overcome.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The transformed believer (S) lives out a life of integrity and generosity (O) to attract the world to God.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (Ethics) is strictly a result of the primary program (Soteriology). One must 'see the beauty' before one can 'shine'.

voorbeelden_god_subject: He experienced the darkness we deserve
voorbeelden_mens_subject: you will have a new life

voorbeelden: we can’t get ourselves off the hook
live as children of the light
It melts your heart. It moves you.
what you’re really looking for is him
you see the truth of who you are
you see the beauty of what he has done
God... actually connects what’s in your brain
that will instill the light of God

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes that the 'ability' (Pouvoir) to be light is a gift of new life (organic growth) rather than a duty (Devoir) to perform.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S2 (Darkness) to ~S2 (Truth of sin) to S1 (Grace/Beauty) via the substitution of Christ.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Christ enters S2 (Darkness) so the hearer can move from ~S2 to S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; darkness is equated with the 'fierce wrath' and 'cosmic separation'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon explicitly rejects moralism ('mechanical growth') in favor of an ontological change wrought by God's initiative.

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Potential for 'Be like the early Christians'
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: The list of integrity, generosity, etc.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: Subject-Switch to Christ on the Cross
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: The Light of the World was plunged into cosmic darkness... so we could be light.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Early Christians and Reformers are used as examples, but specifically as examples of *being changed by grace* rather than *effort*.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides this by stating their change was 'organic' from God.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and motivation through 'melting of the heart' (affection) rather than guilt.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic regeneration leading to synergistic sanctification.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'Sun' (God) to 'Reflected Light' (Believer) is logically and theologically tight.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'Arise, shine' (imperative) and 'Your light has come' (indicative).

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: He experienced the darkness we deserve so we could be light.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: Endowment of a 'new life' that grows organically.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Severe; it is 'cosmic darkness' and 'smudges' only visible in divine light.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative engine is driven by God's action. The human subject is only active as a response to being acted upon.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: The sermon successfully balances the 'must' of the text with the 'can' of the Gospel.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in maintaining God as the primary Actant while still calling for a radical ethical response.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'Sun' metaphor, Greimas shows that the 'Sun' is actually the Sender of competence.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains Isaiah 60; Greimas explains how the sermon's 'engine' moves the hearer from death to life.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'beauty' of Christ is the 'Helper' that provides the 'Vouloir' (motivation) for the Subject.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Kinsman-Redeemer' concept to bridge the gap between the Sender (God) and the Receiver (Man).
